title: Create CSM Admin role
content:
This page explains how to create a role with administrative permissions for Customer Service Management (CSM) entities. This role grants full access to CSM entities only and can be assigned to users who need to manage CSM data.

Prerequisite

To create a role, you must either have the Tenant Admin role or have appropriate role management permissions. For more information, see Assign permissions to a role for Administration modules. 

How to create a CSM Admin role

  1. From the main menu, select Administration > Master Data > People > Roles.
  2. Click   Add at the top of the left pane.
  3. Enter a name for the role in the Name box. For example, CSM Admin.
  4. Enter a code for the role in the Code box. This is used to identify the role internally. The combination of Code and Application must be unique in the system. This means that you can have roles with the same code, as long as they are for different applications.
  5. Select SMAX from the Application list.
  6. Click OK. This adds the role and opens its record.
  7. In the General section, select the Log in to the application permission.
  8. In the Record type section, click Add. 
  9. In the Add Permission dialog, select a record type, select permissions, and click OK or ADD ANOTHER. Perform these steps for the following record types: Company, Brand, Product Model, Product Module, Product Release Version, Product version, Environment, Entitlement, License, and Product Instance. We recommend assigning Create, View, and Update permissions, but you may assign other permissions as needed. The following table explains each permission.
    Permission Description
    View Enables viewing records.
    Delete

    Enables deleting records.

    To ensure data integrity, most of the out-of-the-box entities don't allow deletion from the user interface. We recommend using entity lifecycle to manage OOB records instead of deleting them.

    This permission enables deleting records for custom entities, though. This permission also controls the ability to delete records by using the API.
    Update Enables updating records in the grid, including adding comments. 
    Admin Enables updating records in the studio module.
    Create Enables creating records.
    Comments Enables editing or deleting any existing comments on records.
    This permission takes effect only if the Update permission is also assigned.
    Access Control Override Enables bypassing the record-level access control (RLAC) configuration for the record type. For information about RLAC, see Record-level access control.
  10. Click Save on the toolbar.

Related topics

After creating the CSM Admin role, you can assign it to users or groups. For details, see the "How to assign a role to a user" and "How to assign a role to a group " sections on the Roles page.
